img.alt: Thank you Dunbarton

div.p: Dunbarton Elementary School extends a huge "THANK YOU" to the whole town for supporting the school renovation!

div.p: You can subscribe to any of the calendars above by clicking on the Google Calendar link in the lower right corner.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: The DES office is closed during the COVID-19 shutdown. The foyer will be open 8:00 am until 3:00 pm Monday-Thursday for drop offs.
Please call the School Secretary's line at (603) 774-3181, ext. 201 and leave a message. You will receive a prompt reply.
SAU 67 Social/Emotional Response to Covid-19

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-c5RTEf purZT-AhqUyc-c5RTEf pSzOP-AhqUyc-c5RTEf jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque

img.alt: Thanks Officer Cattabriga. We love you and will miss you

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Dunbarton Elementary School is hosting an online book fair Monday April 6 until Sunday April 19. Twenty-five percent of all sales will benefit the school by supplying books for classrooms, guided reading and the school library. To make sure that DES receives the rewards, please enter the book fair through our Homepage.
Happy Shopping!

img.alt: Dunbarton Elementary School has unveiled the mural created by Artist-in-Residence David Fichter and the students of DES, illustrating the new school motto chosen by our students. Huge thanks to the DES PTO for helping to sponsor this Artist Residency!

div.p: Dunbarton Elementary School has unveiled the mural created by Artist-in-Residence David Fichter and the students of DES, illustrating the new school motto chosen by our students. Huge thanks to the DES PTO for helping to sponsor this Artist Residency!

img.alt: Mrs. Coffee's 4th Grade class is really showing their school spirit for Backwards Wednesday!!

img.alt: Veterans Day breakfast hosted by 6th graders
6th grade sings for Veterans

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: DES hosted our town veterans for a special breakfast and flag ceremony. The 6th grade served breakfast and sang patriotic songs. Thank You Veterans!

img.alt: DES Staff dressed as Kindness Crayons to kick off their "Kindness Campaign"

div.p: DES Staff kicks off the "Kindness Campaign" by showing their true colors! Students are encouraged to look for random acts of kindness by their peers and staff members, and to report those acts. This is all part of furthering DES' emphasis on "Empathy."

img.alt: Eat A Rainbow of Fruits and vegetables

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-II5mzb pSzOP-AhqUyc-II5mzb jXK9ad D2fZ2 wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Look at all of our healthy eaters! Nurse Ginny Hast has created an "Eat A Rainbow of Fruits and vegetables" challenge for DES students. Every time they bring a fruit or veggie for lunch, they get to make a mark on the board! What a way to bring a little color into winter!

div.p: DES is thrilled to announce that our certified therapy dog Lynx has taken up residency to enhance our social-emotional learning. Welcome, Lynx!

img.alt: Roots Club

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-wNfPc pSzOP-AhqUyc-wNfPc jXK9ad D2fZ2 wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Roots Club helped the Dunbarton Garden Club plant daffodils on the Town Common. The Garden Club has been a big supporter of Dunbarton Elementary School, helping with Roots Club and with the 3rd Grade Gingerbread Project!

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-II5mzb pSzOP-AhqUyc-II5mzb jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque
hJDwNd-AhqUyc-OiUrBf jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: We are very happy to announce that the new playground at Dunbarton Elementary School is ready to go for active play!! A huge THANK YOU to the O'Donnelll Insurance Agency of Concord and Manchester for the grant they awarded DES to purchase new playground equipment. We must thank Dan and Michelle Morin and the entire Morin Contracting Services Team for doing an unbelievable job in leading us in this effort, giving their time, machinery, effort, and expertise to this project. They assembled a small army of parent and community volunteers to help with the project.

The Dunbarton PTO will cover all of the extra material costs (perforated pipe, stone, wood chips, etc), which Dan has been tracking. Thank you Dunbarton PTO! Jeff Crosby gave his time and use of his truck while the town provided approximately 50 yards of sand for the site. Woody Bowne and his dedicated staff removed all of the old structures including hundreds of pounds of concrete and steel, which was a significant part of this project.

The PTO’s generous offer, along with the donated time of our volunteers, the donated craftsmanship and equipment of Morin Contracting Services and the two playground grants, means there will be very little cost to the Dunbarton taxpayer. The next step will be to install two more playground pieces when they arrive sometime in October, one will be placed next to the new structure, adjacent to the Gaga Pit, where we have already prepped the site. The other site is TBD.
Cheers to a another great year at DES and to our wonderful community!

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Dunbarton Elementary School · 20 Robert Rogers Rd. · Dunbarton, NH 03046 · Tel: 603-774-3181 · fax: 603-774-3186
